授業目的: This course aims to acquaint students with conceptual approaches and perspectives relevant to the understanding of conflict, and further familiarize students with issues and cases of actual conflicts. The overall objective is to introduce students to the academic subject of international conflicts in particular and international politics in general.
到達目標: Students will learn and become knowledgeable about fundamental concepts and theories of conflict.Students will develop a better understanding of the complex issues that cause international conflicts by studying actual cases of conflicts. Additionally, students will learn and become familiar with different aspects of the impacts of conflict,and  many ways of dealing with conflicts.

関連科目: International Relations, International Security, International Law, International Organizations, Global Poltics, Peace Studies.
授業の概要・背景: Conflict, whether of an active or a latent nature, has been inherently part of human history. Understanding, addressing, and managing conflicts within or among countries constitutes one of the major challenges in the realms of governance and international affairs. Although the events of inter-state conflicts continue to decrease since the end of the Cold War, many countries across the world are faced with violent conflict and insecurity, and several international conflicts persist among some countries. Both interstate and intrastate conflicts can affect areas and societies far beyond the conflict zones. Ours is still a world of conflict amid a growing but fragile peace.Studying conflicts helps us understand why they occur, how they affect societies and us,and how they are managed or resolved. This way,we can make sense of the theoretical knowledge of the academic subject of international conflicts.
授業方法: This is a lecture-based course. However, students are strongly encouraged to actively participate in the class by asking relevant questions, making comments, expressing their thoughts and taking part in in-class activities.

第1回:
• Overview of the course outline.
• Explanation and definition of key concepts.
• Overview of global trend of conflicts.
• Explanation of important information concerning the course Sylabus and grading criteria.
第2回:
• Conflicts:Theoretical and Historical Perspectives.
• Types of conflicts.
• Conflict analysis methods.
• Conflict Management/Resolution Approaches.
第3回:
Cases of International Conflicts: Global level(1)
• The First World War
• The Second World War
第4回:
Cases of International Conflicts: Global level (2)
• The Cold War.
• Post-Cold War Conflict trend
第5回:
Cases of International Conflicts : Asia
• The Vietnam War
• The Korean War / North Korea’s Nuclear crisis.
• Territorial Disputes/ the South China Sea.
第6回:
Cases of International Conflict: Regional level: The Middle East
• The Arab/Palestinian-Israeli conflict.
• The Suez crisis.
• The first Gulf War.
• 9/11 and the war on terror.
第7回:
Cases of International Conflict: Regional level-Africa (1)
• Conflicts in Africa: Historical and Political backgrounds.
• State-making, Identity and African conflicts: Case study (The Nigerian Civil War, Sudan's civil wars).
第8回:
Cases of International Conflict: Regional level-Africa (2)
• Seperatist movements and conflicts in Africa: Colonial legacies or misrule?
• The Post-Cold War and the regionalization of conflicts: The Rwanda Genocide, the Congo war.
• Violent non-state actors in African conflicts.
第9回:
International Interventions in Conflicts
• Motives and Arguments for intervention.
• The UN and Conflicts.
• Regional and sub-regional organizations and conflicts: The African Union and African Regional Economic Communities (RECs).
• Non-governmental organizations' roles in conflicts.
第10回:
War,Conflict, and International Law
• The Just war theory and other arguments on War.
• International Conventions: The Geneva Conventions.
• Mass Atrocity Crimes (Genocide, crime against humanity, war crimes) and the role of the ICC.
• Emerging Norms: Humanitarian Intervention, Human Security, and the Responsibility to Protect (R2P).
第11回:
Conflict and Society.
• Conflict and displacement.
• Conflict and resources, security and development.
• women, children and conflict.
